WRITING.TEXT:
The game is fun but you kinda need the God leaders for that to happen, the metagame has been shaken.
I'm only having fun because I have pretty much all top tier cards except for the mono leaders, so I can pick one as a friend and still manage.
But I'm one of the exceptions. If you're not stacked with top tier units, rerolling for a Mono-GOD is the best choice to feel relevant again.

I'd say he's on the higher tier of SRs, maybe the best one right now that Buutenks became SSR.
Well, not so sure actually, I dokkaned my Buutenks and realized I can't use him along Gogeta on Super Strikes, I still need him as SR.
But this Buuhan is the strongest if his special effect procs.

I can stop pulling since I got Buff Buu and already dokkaned him.
What a relief, this Buuhan event is too annoying, not worth trying to win 10 times. At least one can walk away with something good for less pain.
I'd also say that Kid Buu is worth putting in SS tier. If you pull another one, you shouldn't raise Buff Buu SA.
They pretty much have only ATK links and share them all except the TUR one, it's worth using both on a Mono-TEQ. If they link together it would be crazy.
He only gets a small increase in power by dokkaning, SSR version is still pretty tough.

The subs is where it gets difficult. I already won 5 times but it depends on luck.
Right now I'm running Golden Frieza, PHY Super Gotenks, Kibitokai, Ultimate Gohan and Whis, hoping for a lucky stun.
I've also had success without Kibitokai, using Gogeta instead. Gotenks could also be replaced but he's a great help.
This fight is ridiculous, victory isn't certain. Without having double Super Vegito, it all depends on luck

Well, for general use, I say it's between Buutenks and Beerus.
They both achieve ATK higher than the average SSR under the right conditions.
SR Beerus linked with TEQ Whis is actually stronger than him. Of course, that doesn't matter now since he dokkans.
And Buutenks getting a full row of red orbs (could be even more if you get lucky) has reached 28k for me, or at least pretty close.
Buutenks will jump straight to SS tier with a dokkan, or at least a solid S. I already consider him pretty close to S being a SR, only his stats hold him back.
He has this special combination of utility (Super sealer) with a damage passive and relevant links, so you're not hindering your team by using him.
Buu also has a use for events, like Blue. On Super strike events he is MVP giving +3 ki to Gogeta for a low cost.

Since his passive is already a high chance of stunning, I hope they give him the Gotenks treatment and slap a 30% ATK increase on him.
That is a surprisingly good way of keeping cards relevant, I find that cards with no % increase are really weak unless it is a really big flat boost.

Meruem wakes up on Ash's body and discovers Team Rocket trying to follow him, they are annoying and he decides to fight them barehanded.
He doesn't have his tail or strenght anymore but is ruthless enough to win against their small pokemen and beat them badly.
Then he goes on to ask them about the world. They understand he's some powerful entity on the brat's body and are too afraid to lie, so he gets reliable info about pokemon, trainers, gyms, etc.
On Round One, he wins mid-hard diff.
He would train like a madman to know the full extent of his pokemon's powers, he may even train them to max level, depending on how the anime works, I don't remember if they get stronger over fights.
But even assuming he has them at the same level as Ash, he will know them better.
He's a King with a powerful presence and a personality fit to be a Ruler, that would allow him to command even Charizard on the first league, and of course, he surely learned all the theory before participating, so his strategies will be perfect.
Meruem on HxH was already the perfect gamer, he was learning every possible strategy game and perfecting them within 10 matches. Ash came pretty close to winning everytime, so Meruem should accomplish it.
Except for Tobias, now that would be a match worth seeing. Meruem is the perfect strategist, but fighting against legendaries is a real handicap. He'd enjoy this fight. Instead of overpowering Tobias with brains, his wits would only close the gap between their teams. It could go both sides. But he'd take Darkrai down like a bitch using Heracross, that's for sure.
Round Two: Low diff.
He travels the world catching pokemon befriending them and uses teams with glorious synergy, but he's actually looking for the very strongest.
Strategy is a tool for the weak to overcome someone better, if he wants to be the absolute King of Pokemon, he needs to get Legendary Pokemon with so much raw power that there's nothing to do against them.
He gets Ho-Oh, Kyogre, Cresselia, Terrakion, Yveltal and eventually Mewtwo. They'd follow him outside their pokeballs and roflstomp everyone.

WRITING.TITLE: [Analysis] Has anyone paid attention to TEQ SS2 Goku's leader skill?
WRITING.TEXT:
I see him on Z tier, but after searching the whole place I see no one talking about his leader skill, which is even incorrectly written on his character analysis and tier list.
Maybe people saw that and overlooked it, since it's listed as +50% HP and DEF for STR TEQ.
But it's wrong! It's 50% HP AND ATK for those 2 types. He'd be actually pretty underwhelming/WT niche if his only worth was a +3 ki passive, since he isn't hitting hard anytime soon, but boy am I happy of pulling him.
If you don't have a god leader, just use this banner with double rates featuring him and get yourself a mini-god. 50% is as good as an undokkaned GOD, and I'm sure they'd still be top tier without being TURs
So yeah, just a heads up. He obviously won't replace a GOD leader if you already have one, but if you don't, this guy is many times easier to get and does the same job, one big boost to HP ATK. If you already have him, congrats.
And the fact that it gives a boost to STR type comes especially handy considering than most people with Gogeta would be taking him into any battle, at least that's what I do, putting to use those insane stats.
Also remember, even tho he doesn't provide ki with his leader skill, his passive makes up for it (+3 ki to STR/TEQ), so it isn't really hard to SA if your team has good linking and orb manipulation (TEQ has Bardock and SSB Goku)
I finally feel "in the meta" again with him, Gogeta was getting rusty. With a SS3 Gotenks support and this guy you can go over 100k life and that's pretty.
Really happy they put this character outside a Dokkanfest. Maybe they'll start releasing more characters like this? HP ATK for 2 types and no Ki DEF boost. It could work for those who can't get the very best ones. They wouldn't be as good without a +3 ki passive tho.

Actually TURles will be much better on almost all teams.
INT Cell will be more useful against Super Vegito and Gogeta, but outside of those, TURles provides ki and damage for your team. He also links well with heroes (saiyan links)

THIS
I was just thinking about this.
I recommended HxH to a friend and he's starting the election arc, I know he'll have issues with Alluka and I already planned to tell him a little mental fix.
Imagine all the healed Gon stuff being just a dream Alluka gave him, her power isn't absolute and she could only remove the dark Nen to finally give him a peaceful death, this assuming he was trapped into a nightmare.
Killua managed to at least free Gon from his endless suffering and walks away with Alluka to never be seen again. Leorio failed to protect his friend and changes his personality, becoming much more serious about being a doctor, we get to see him skipping parties and stuff only to study, with some tears falling on the book he's reading.
Days later, Kurapika checks up his phone only to see Leorio's desperate messages but now it's too late. He breaks down after realizing what he lost and how much of an hypocrite he was for letting them down. We get some scenes without dialogue on him travelling and doing research.
He's last seen arriving at the spider's nest and facing the entire Phantom Troupe ready to die going berserk on them, having lost the will to live.
Now the last scene of Meruem and Komugi holding hands coming after all of that hits even harder.
But of course, Kurapika dying would interfere with Togashi's next arc, but the 2011 anime could have ended like that on a tragic note.
I kinda let myself go there, in my defense I just finished the anime a few days ago and I'm still influenced by Togashi's dark writing.

I'm so salty he didn't get a rebirth on that Kaioken dokkanfest.
I mean, no one expected SSB Kaioken so early, we were like "yeah don't worry he'll probably dokkan or be useful against SSB Goku"
Nope, they just featured him alongside Champa, another shitty card.

For anyone seeing this in the future, SS2 Goku's leader skill is 50% atk AND HP increase, not DEF.
He's like an undokkaned GOD leader, he doesn't give 2 ki but his passive gives 3, so he's one of the best leaders you can use. He's replacing Gogeta for me since I don't have any GOD.
But strong against Dark!
There are enough Apache attack helicopters to take over a country by now

WRITING.TITLE: Just a beautiful night gazing at the internet

WRITING.TEXT: Call the cops when you see 2pac

I think I talk from experience, I tried to use a villain team to farm AGL Whis and ended up sick after 3 fights.
Way too boring. They don't do crap. No good leader skill, I used Raditz, Turles just came out a day ago. Now I think that he's pretty much mandatory to make villains work.
But even then, they lack damage. Barely any links and best leader skill is a vanilla +3 ki. I rarely get to 100k with only villains. "Oh yeah, I finally managed to get my Bojack to SA!... That's all? 60k?"
Those 2 events are great to compare their efficiency. And yeah maybe with FP Frieza or PHY Broly it would be easy, but those are pretty much units of the highest tier and dokkanfest exclusives, meanwhile Heroes don't depend on Vegito or Gogeta to be strong.

This makes me think of ONE and his Mob Psycho manga.
Dude just came up with a nice story and can't draw much better than Togashi, but he pushes forward
